42  police commission   et seq  library board   et seq  planning ch 62  plan commission   et seq  architectural control board   et seq  administration and enforcement of traffic regulations   et seq  utilities ch 90  administration and enforcement of sewer service   et seq  water commission   et seq  aquatic weed commission   et seq article i  in general city bid statute adopted as a complete alternative to the requirements established by wis stats  6154 and 6155 wis stats  6215 shall apply to village contracts the authority vested thereunder in the board of public works shall be exercised by the village board or such officers to whom such duties are delegated 09 unauthorized persons prohibited from village of pewaukee municipal buildings except for buildings or portions of buildings designated as open to the general public no person except active or probationary members of a department shall enter or be permitted or allowed to enter any village of pewaukee municipal building or handle operate or use any material apparatus or equipment belonging to or in the custody of any village department unless such person has been authorized andor directed to do so by the village board or the head of the department  151988 article ii  village board footnotes  2  cross reference elections ch 30 state law reference village board generally wis stats  6132 division 1  generally membership the village board shall consist of a village president who shall be elected in oddnumbered years for a term of two years and six trustees three of whom shall be elected each year at the regular village election for twoyear terms 01 state law reference similar provisions wis stats  6120 6124  authority to set salaries of president and trustees wis stats  6132 regular meetings regular meetings of the village board shall be held on the first and third tuesday of each month at  pm any regular meeting falling upon a legal holiday shall be held on the next following secular day at the same hour and place all meetings of the board shall be held in the village hall including special and adjourned meetings unless otherwise designated by threefourths vote of the board notice of a substitute meeting place shall be given the public by posting a written notice of the substitute meeting place and time of the meeting on the outer door of the village hall at least eight hours prior to such meeting 01   5181993 special meetings a special meetings of the village board may be called by any two trustees in writing filed with the clerktreasurer at least 24 hours prior to the time specified for such meeting the clerktreasurer shall as soon as practicable notify each trustee of the time and purpose of such meeting by causing a written notice to be delivered to each trustee personally if he can be found and if he cannot be found then the presence of an adult member of the family of the trustee b the clerktreasurer shall cause an affidavit showing service of such notice to be filed in his office prior to the time fixed for such special meeting special meetings may be held without such notice when all members of the village board are present in person or consent in writing to the holding of the meeting such written consent to be filed with the clerktreasurer prior to the beginning of the meeting any special meeting attended by all the trustees shall be a regular meeting for the transaction of any business that may come before such meeting except that the business stated as the purpose of the special meeting shall be the first order of business at such meeting 02 adjournment to specific date the village board may by a majority vote of those present but not less than three affirmative votes adjourn to a specific date and hour 03 division 2  board rules and procedures conduct of meetings a the business of the village board shall be conducted in the following order 1 call to order by presiding officer pledge of allegiance and moment of silence 2 roll call if a quorum is not present the meeting shall thereupon adjourn which may be to a specific date pursuant to section  3 public hearings 4 reading the minutes of the preceding meeting and approving them if correct and rectifying mistakes if any exist 5 comments and suggestions from citizen present 6 ordinances 7 resolutions 8 unfinished business from previous meetings 9 new business 10 comments and suggestions from citizen present 04   652007   10162007   562008 duties of presiding officer the president at the stated hour shall call the meeting to order he shall preserve order and decorum decide all questions in order and conduct the proceedings of the meeting in accordance with the parliamentary rules contained in roberts rules of order newly revised unless otherwise provided by statute or by this article any member shall have the right of appeal from a decision of the presiding officer no appeal shall be debatable and the appeal may be sustained by a majority of the members present exclusive of the president 05 absences a absence of the president or any trustee shall whenever applicable be governed by wis stats  6123 relating to temporary vacancies or absences and wis stats  1703 1724 relating to vacancies b if the president is absent at the designated time for any meeting the clerktreasurer or in his absence the senior trustee present based on date of original election as trustee shall call the meeting to order and preside until the board shall by motion select an acting president for that meeting c whenever the president or any trustee shall be absent or temporarily incapacitated for longer than two consecutive regular meetings the board shall appoint a trustee to discharge his duties until he returns or until such disability is removed if such officer shall be absent from four consecutive regular meetings and it shall appear that his absence will continue indefinitely the board shall proceed under wis stats  1713 to remove such officer and fill the vacancy created thereby in accordance with wis stats  1724 provided the board shall give notice of intent to remove him by registered mail or personal service upon such officer at least ten days prior to any board meeting at which a resolution to remove him shall be passed and adopted 06 vacation of chair whenever the presiding officer shall desire to speak upon any question or to make any motion he shall vacate the chair and designate a trustee to preside temporarily 07 committee of the whole a membership the village board shall constitute the committee of the whole and the village president shall serve as chairperson b duties the committee of the whole shall be an advisory body and shall review such financial and personnel matters as shall be referred to said committee by the village board or the village administrator and shall make recommendations for action by the village board regarding said matters on each matter referred to said committee the committee of the whole shall consider the recommendation of the village administrator in making its review and before forwarding its recommendation to the village board  761999 appointed committees a the following committees are established and members shall be appointed by the president subject to confirmation by the village board at the first regular meeting in may 1 reserved 2 public works and safety committee a membership the public works and safety committee shall consist of five members inclusive of the chairperson two of said members shall be members of the village board and shall serve oneyear terms the remaining three members shall be residents of the village and shall serve twoyear terms so staggered that not more than two members shall be appointed in any one year all appointments shall be made by the village president and be subject to confirmation by the village board b duties the public works and safety committee shall advise the board regarding matters referred to the committee by the board including matters that relate to public works and public safety streets sewers lighting storm sewers village work crews curbs and gutters sidewalks dumps cemeteries building regulations civil defense traffic and parking regulation b each committee shall consist of three members  however no trustee nor the president shall serve on more than two committees the village president shall be a member of the finance committee the chairmen of the committees shall be designated by the president subject to confirmation by the board officers employees and members of all other committees boards and commissions shall be appointed as called for by ordinance or statute and otherwise by the village president c the conduct and operation of each committee shall be reviewable only by the board except as otherwise provided by statute 08   841969   2171998   761999  i 922003   5162006   552009 committee meetings previous notice of each committee meeting shall be filed with the clerktreasurer and each meeting shall be open to the public any committee may require any village officer to confer with it and supply information needed in connection with any matter pending before the committee each committee shall hold one regular meeting each month on a day and place to be designated by the committee at the first regular village board meeting in may of each year special committee meetings shall be called by the chairman at the request of one committee member 09 committee reports each committee chairman shall at the next regular meeting submit a report on all matters referred to the committee unless a longer time is granted by vote of the village board and such report shall be entered in the proceedings all written reports shall recommend a definite action by the board on each item shall be signed by a majority of the committee in question and shall be filed with the clerktreasurer prior to each meeting minority reports may be submitted 10 reserved editors note i adopted sept 2 200 repealed   in its entirety formerly said section pertained to action on committee reports and derived from 11 ordinances resolutions other matters no ordinance or resolution shall be considered by the village board unless presented by a trustee which ordinance or resolution shall be in writing 12  i 922003 enactment of ordinances resolutions motions a ordinances are enactments by the village board for the government of the village enforceable as long as their provisions are applicable b resolutions exhaust their force by once being fully enforced c motions carry on the daytoday management of the village d no ordinance shall be enacted amended or repealed except following the occurrence of at least one of the following conditions 1 three days have elapsed since the date of the introduction of the ordinance 2 the ordinance has been the subject of a public hearing within the past six months e resolutions may be enacted amended or repealed immediately following their introduction   i 922003   2 672005  i 642013 reserved editors note i adopted sept 2 200 repealed   in its entirety formerly said section pertained to action by ordinance committee and derived from as subsequently amended by  adopted aug 4 1969 conduct of deliberations the deliberations of the village board shall be conducted in the following manner 1 no trustee shall address the board until he has been recognized by the presiding officer he shall thereupon address himself to the president and confine his remarks to the question under discussion and avoid all personalities 2 when two or more members simultaneously seek recognition the presiding officer shall name the member who is to speak first 3 no person other than a member shall address the board except under order of business as provided in section  4 no motion shall be discussed or acted upon unless it has been seconded unless the rules permit one trustee to initiate action no motion shall be withdrawn or amended without the consent of the person making the motion and the person seconding it 5 when a question is under discussion no action shall be in order except to adjourn to lay on the table move the previous question to postpone to a certain day to refer to a committee to amend to postpone indefinitely these motions shall have precedence in the order listed 6 any member desirous of terminating the debate may move the previous question in which event the president shall announce the question as shall the main question now be put if a majority of the members present vote in the affirmative the main question shall be taken without further debate its effect being to put an end to all debate and bring the board to a direct vote first upon any pending amendments and then upon the main question 7 any trustee may demand an aye and nay vote on any matter and such vote shall be entered in the proceedings every member shall vote when a question is put unless the board by a majority vote of those present shall excuse him for special cause a majority vote of all members of the board in favor of any proposed ordinance resolution or appointment shall be necessary for passage or approval unless a larger number is required by statute except as otherwise provided a majority vote of those present shall prevail in other cases 8 a motion to adjourn shall always be in order  and a motion to adjourn to lay on the table and a call for the previous question shall be decided without debate 9 no member of the board whether he is a trustee or the village president shall vote on any question involving his own character or conduct his right as a member or his pecuniary interest 14 reconsideration any member voting in the majority may move for a reconsideration of the vote of any question at that meeting or at the succeeding regular meeting a motion to reconsider being put and lost shall not be renewed a trustee may not change his vote on any question after the result has been announced 16 transcription of minutes within ten days after each meeting of the village board the clerktreasurer shall supply to each trustee at his residence a typewritten copy of the proceedings perforated for insertion in a ring binder by majority action of those present the board may dispense with the reading of the minutes at the ensuing meeting 17 suspension of rules this article or any part of this article may be temporarily suspended in connection with any matter under consideration by a recorded vote of twothirds of the members of the village board present 18 article iii  officers and employes footnotes  3  cross reference the fixing of salaries of public officials and employees and regarding civil service saved from repeal  3  department of buildings and building inspector   et seq  joint municipal fire department   et seq  firerescue chief   et seq  health department   et seq  head librarian    joint park and recreation department   et seq state law reference selection of officers generally wis stats    payment of expenses and judgments regarding municipal officers in their official capacity generally wis stats  89535 89542 division 1  generally officials the following officials shall be appointed by the village president subject to confirmation of the village board and shall serve for indefinite terms 1 village assessor 2 building inspector 3 electrical inspector 4 plumbing inspector 5 civil defense director 6 fire chief 7 reserved 8 administrative engineer 021   5151978   6152004 division 2  administrator village administrator a employment the village administrator shall be hired by the village board and shall serve pursuant to the terms of an employment contract approved by the village board b duties the village board employs the village administrator to manage direct supervise and coordinate the day to day business and affairs of the village pursuant to the direction and supervision of the village board and in accordance with village ordinances and the laws of the state the duties of the village administrator shall be as follows 1 to manage direct supervise and coordinate the day to day business and affairs of the village 2 to coordinate supervise and direct the duties and activities of the villages nonelected officers department heads and other employees except officers andor employees who are directly appointed by and who are directly responsible to the village president the village board or an independent commission 3 to aid in the establishment maintenance and administration of personnel policies and procedures including recruiting dismissal compensation fringe benefits and labor relations 4 to assign and delegate such duties and responsibilities to other village employees as administrator judges to be appropriate or as administrator may be directed by the village board 5 to act as an official spokesperson for and representative of the village as directed by the village board  and to act as a liaison to other municipal bodies the county board the state legislature the governor and federal agencies 6 to develop and maintain standard operating procedures regarding the villages business affairs andor the exercise of governmental power and to suggest changes to village ordinances where appropriate 7 to supervise and coordinate the preparation of the annual budget of the village  to analyze and suggest measures designed to establish and maintain sound fiscal operation  and to oversee expenditures and investments 8 to maximize the amount of money the village receives from federal and state revenue sharing and the other tax relief assistance or grant programs 9 to be generally knowledgeable concerning the villages legal affairs and administrative matters 10 to carry out such other duties and responsibilities as shall from time to time be assigned by the village board 11 to assume and carry out such other duties as may be necessary from time to time to maintain a sound and efficient municipal operation 022a 11101997   7182000 a  village attorney the village board shall appoint an attorney or attorneys licensed to practice law in the state of wisconsin to provide legal representation and legal services to the village as village attorney pursuant to the terms of a contract letter of engagement andor other suitable and sufficient agreement or document approved by the village board  6152004 division 3  administrative engineer duties and powers a the village administrative engineer shall 1 have charge of the operation and maintenance of all village of pewaukee property lands building improvements equipment and public ways 2 supervise and inspect all engineering and construction undertaken by the village 3 maintain records on and assist the village president in negotiation and sale of the pewaukee industrial park 4 consult with the fire chief and police chief in the administration of their duties as technical advisor 5 consult with and make recommendations to the village board and all committees and commissions created by the village board and shall attend regular meetings of the village board and plan commission b the village engineer shall have the power to set aside any action taken by the department head in charge of the department of public works and the department head in charge of sewers and may supersede such department heads in the functions of their offices c the village engineer shall have the power to direct the department of public works or the sewer department or any employees of those departments to perform the work for any other department or division the direction of an employee to work in another department for a period of less than ten days is deemed not a transfer promotion or demotion under civil service d the village engineer shall establish and maintain a building inspection department and supervise the activities of the building plumbing and electrical inspectors 15 division 4  clerktreasurer footnotes  4  state law reference clerk generally wis stats  6125  treasurer generally wis stats  6126 audit of clerktreasurers records annual recurring audits shall be made of the records of the clerktreasurer by a certified public accountant or by the municipal accounting division of the state department of audit whichever is designated by the village board 08 article iv  finance footnotes  5  cross reference the issuance of corporate bonds and notes of the village of whatever name or description saved from repeal  1  the letting of contracts without bids saved from repeal  8  tax and special assessment levies saved from repeal  9  release of persons from liability saved from repeal  10  budget ordinances resolutions and actions saved from repeal  14  schedule of deposits saved from repeal  16  court deposits   et seq  user charges for sewer service   et seq  connection charges for water service   et seq division 1  generally fiscal year the calendar year shall be the fiscal year 03 bills and claims all bills and other financial claims against the village of pewaukee shall upon receipt be referred by the clerktreasurer to the finance committee for report at the ensuing meeting of the village board 13 appropriation ordinances or resolutions all ordinances or resolutions appropriating money or creating any charge against the village of pewaukee other than the payment of claims for purchases or work previously authorized by the village board shall only be acted upon by the board at the next regular meeting provided this provision may be suspended by affirmative action by threefourths of all members of the board a roll call vote shall be taken and recorded on all appropriations 15 division 2  budget village funds to be spent in accordance with appropriation no money shall be drawn from the treasury of the village of pewaukee nor shall any obligation for the expenditure of money be incurred except in pursuance of the annual appropriation in the adopted budget or when changed as authorized by section  at the close of each fiscal year any unencumbered balance of an appropriation shall revert to the general fund and shall be subject to reappropriation  but appropriations may be made by the village board to be paid out of the income of the current year in furtherance of improvements or other objects or works that will not be completed within such year  and any such appropriation shall continue in force until the purpose for which it was made shall have been accomplished or abandoned 06 budget a departmental estimates each year each officer department and committee shall file with the clerktreasurer by november 1 an itemized statement of disbursements made to carry out the powers and duties of such officer department or committee during the preceding fiscal year and a detailed statement of the receipts and disbursements on account of any special fund under the supervision of such officer department or committee during such year and of the conditions and management of such fund also detailed estimates of the same matters for the current fiscal year and for the ensuing fiscal year such statements shall be presented in the form prescribed by the clerktreasurer and shall be designated as departmental estimates and shall be as nearly uniform as possible for the main divisions of all departments b finance committee to prepare 1 budget to include each year the finance committee of the village board shall prepare and submit to the board a proposed budget presenting a financial plan for conducting the affairs of the village for the ensuing calendar year the budget shall include the following information a the expense of conducting each department and activity of the village for the ensuing fiscal year and corresponding items for the current year and last preceding fiscal year with reasons for any increase and decrease recommended as compared with appropriations for the current year b an itemization of all anticipated income of the village from sources other than general property taxes and bonds issued with a comparative statement of the amounts received by the village from each of the same or similar sources for the last preceding and current fiscal year c an estimate of the amount of money to be raised from general property taxes that with income from other sources will be necessary to meet the proposed expenditures d such other information as may be required by the board and by law 2 copies the village shall provide a reasonable number of copies of the budget thus prepared for distribution to citizens c hearing the finance committee shall submit to the board at the time the annual budget is submitted the draft of an appropriation ordinance providing for the expenditures proposed for the ensuing fiscal year upon the submission of the proposed appropriation ordinance to the board it shall be deemed to have been regularly introduced the board shall hold a public hearing on the budget and the proposed appropriation ordinance as required by law following the public hearing the proposed appropriation ordinance may be changed or amended and shall take the same course in the board as other ordinances 04 changes in budget the amount of the tax to be levied or certified the amounts of the various appropriations and their purposes shall not be changed after approval of the budget except by a twothirds vote of the entire membership of the village board notice of such changes shall be given by publication within ten days after such changes in the official village newspaper 05 division 3  tax rolls and special assessments preparation of tax roll and tax receipts  aggregate tax stated on roll pursuant to wis stats  70652 the clerktreasurer shall in computing the tax roll insert only the aggregate amount of state county school and local taxes in a single column in the roll opposite the parcel or tract of land against which the tax is levied or in the case of personal property in a single column opposite the name of the person against whom the tax is levied 011 duplicate treasurers bond eliminated a bond eliminated the village of pewaukee elects not to give the bond on the treasurer provided for by wis stats  70671 b village liable for default of treasurer pursuant to wis stats  70672 the village shall be obligated to pay in case the treasurer shall fail to do so all state of wisconsin and waukesha county taxes required by law to be paid by such treasurer to the county treasurer 02 special assessments a assessments for public works or current service in addition to other methods provided by law special assessments for any public work or improvement or any current service may be levied in accordance with the provisions of this section b preliminary resolution whenever the village board shall determine that any public work or improvement or any current service shall be financed in whole or in part by special assessments levied under this section it shall adopt a resolution setting forth such intention and the time either before or after completion of the work or improvement when the amount of such assessments shall be determined and levied the number of annual installments if any in which such assessments may be paid the rate of interest to be charged on the unpaid balance and the terms on which any of such assessments may be deferred while no use of the improvements is made in connection with the property c procedure when hearing held after completion the provisions of wis stats  6660 shall apply to special assessments levied under this section  except that when the board determines by resolution as provided in subsection b of this section that the hearing on such assessments shall be held subsequent to the completion of the work or improvements or the rendition of the service the report required by wis stats  66603 shall contain a statement of the final cost of the work service or improvement in lieu of an estimate of such cost d notice of hearing notice of the time and place of the public hearing on any special assessment proposed to be levied and notice of the final assessment and terms of payment shall be given by mail to every person whose property is affected by such assessment and whose mailing address can be determined with reasonable diligence e special assessments a lien any special assessment levied under this section shall be a lien against the property assessed from the date of the final resolution of the board determining the amount of such levy f appeals the provisions of wis stats  666012 and 66622 relating to appeal shall apply to any special assessments levied under this section 10 division 4  board of review composition the board of review shall consist of the village president the clerktreasurer three citizen members appointed by the village president subject to confirmation of the village board and one alternate member who shall be a citizen appointed by the village president subject to confirmation of the village board the citizen members shall be appointed for staggered threeyear terms with the year of appointment as follows one member for one year one member for two years and one member for three years the initial term for the alternate shall be for one year 031    7202004 organization at the first meeting of the board of review the members shall organize by the election of a chairman and a vicechairman the clerktreasurer shall act as secretary of the board the board may employ such other stenographers and reporters as it may deem necessary 032 compensation all members of the board of review except officials who are compensated on a fulltime basis shall be paid for each day of attendance at meetings of the board at such rate as established by the village board evening meetings shall be considered as half days of attendance 03 article v  abandoned unclaimed obsolete unused property disposal of abandoned andor unclaimed property except as otherwise specified in this article the village of pewaukee may dispose of abandoned andor unclaimed property held by any of its departments or offices and which has been unclaimed for a period of 30 days after coming into the custody of any village department or office and after notice that such abandoned property is in the custody of the village has been published in the official newspaper of the village disposal in a manner set forth in this article is found to be in the best interest of the public and the village the village shall maintain an inventory of the property and record of the date and method of disposal including the consideration received for the property if any and the name and address of the person taking possession of the property the inventory shall be kept as a public record for a period of not less than two years from the date of disposal of the property this article is enacted pursuant to the provisions of wis stats    151988  vi 9182007 sealed bids a the village of pewaukee may dispose of abandoned andor unclaimed property by advertising the property and soliciting sealed bids whenever the property would in the judgment of the village board not be sold for its fair value the village may accept or reject any or all bids but if the property is sold to a bidder it shall be sold to the person who makes the highest bid such sales shall be conducted by the finance committee in conjunction with the village department or office acting as custodian of the property b all property sold in this manner shall be recorded on an inventory filed with the clerktreasurer this inventory shall include a description of the property a record of the date and method of sale the name and address of the buyer and the amount paid to the village for the property sold c records of all sales shall be retained in accordance with the appropriate provisions of this the laws of the state of wisconsin d all receipts from such sales after deducting the expenses of storing the property and conducting the sale shall be paid into the general fund of the village treasury  151988 public auction a the village of pewaukee may dispose of abandoned andor unclaimed property by holding an annual public auction at such auction the highest bid for any such abandoned andor unclaimed property shall be accepted unless the bid is deemed inadequate in which event all bids may be rejected if all bids are rejected or no bid is received the village may either readvertise the sale adjourn the sale to a definite date sell the abandoned andor unclaimed property at a private sale or junk the abandoned andor unclaimed property such auction shall be conducted under the supervision of the finance committee in conjunction with the village department or office acting as custodian of the property b all receipts from such auction shall be paid into the general fund of the village treasury after deducting the expenses of storing the property and conducting the auction  151988 internet auction the village of pewaukee may dispose of abandoned obsolete or unclaimed property use of an internet auction and property disposition service which will facilitate public auctions to the highest bidder for said property all receipts from such auction shall be paid in the general fund of the village treasury after deducting the expenses of storing the property and the internet auction process records of sale shall be retained for not less than two years in accordance with the provisions of this code and the laws of the state of wisconsin a sale via public auction may include the sale of items via a public auction website internet using a third party to assist in the sale of the items provided that a list shall be preserved of the articles so sold the price for which each item was sold and the names of the owners or supposed owners from whom the articles were taken or received three days notice shall be given to the public in the official newspaper of the village that unclaimed items will be placed with an internet auction site it shall not be necessary to publish a list of the articles to be sold but it shall be sufficient to give notice that the unclaimed articles remaining in the possession of the village which have remained unclaimed for 30 days will be sold at auction via the internet naming the website of the auctioneer and giving the beginning date of any such sale the village shall also endeavor to include a copy of the notice on its official website although failure to do so shall not void any sale i 9182007 release of abandoned andor unclaimed property a value under $1000 the village of pewaukee may release abandoned or unclaimed property to the finder of such property who has turned such property in to any village department or office after a period of 30 days and if the value of the property is less than $1000 without advertising the property the finderclaimant shall sign a property inventory form upon receipt of the property b value over $1000 1 the village may release abandoned or unclaimed property to the finder of such property who has turned such property in to any village department or office and the value of the property is more than $1000 after completing the following requirements a if the value of the property is less than $10000 the village shall advertise that the property is being held by the village the advertisement shall be a legal advertisement in the official newspaper of the village if no person claims the property within 30 days after the advertisement is published the property may be given to the finderclaimant upon payment of the costs of the advertisement and the costs of storage the finderclaimant shall sign a property inventory form upon receipt of the property b if the value of the property is over $10000 the village shall advertise that the property is being held by the village the advertisement shall be a legal advertisement in the official newspaper of the village and shall be published three times once every 60 days if no person claims the property within six months from the date of the first advertisement the property may be given to the finderclaimant upon payment of the costs of the advertisements and the costs of storage the finderclaimant shall sign a property inventory form upon receipt of the property if the finderclaimant refuses to pay the advertising and storage costs the property shall be disposed of in the manner described in section  section  or section  2 all funds collected from findersclaimants for the costs of advertising and storage shall be deposited with the clerktreasurer and applied to the proper account for payment of advertising and storage bills  5 151988  iii 9182007 village employees any employee of the village of pewaukee who finds abandoned or unclaimed property while engaged in his duties must turn the property over to his supervisor and may not claim the property in the manner set forth in section  the property shall instead be disposed of in a manner described in section  section  or section  an employee may submit a sealed bid or participate in a public auction to obtain abandoned or unclaimed property  151988  iv 9182007 obsolete and unused property a the village of pewaukee may dispose of obsolete or unused village property or equipment in the manner set forth in section  section  or section  b the custodian of the obsolete or unused village property or equipment shall notify the finance committee in writing of its intent to dispose of the property or equipment 30 days prior to its proposed sale bids auction or other manner and shall prior to disposing of such property obtain authorization for disposition from the village board c no village property or equipment shall be sold or otherwise disposed of without the knowledge of and without authorization from the village board  151988  ii 9182007 public library the provisions of this article shall not apply to the village of pewaukee public library 1 151988 disposal of abandoned or unclaimed property by police department in addition to all other provisions of this article the following provisions shall also apply to abandoned andor unclaimed property which is in the custody of the village of pewaukee police department 1 the property shall be brought to the police department where a property inventory form shall be completed and a property inventory number assigned to the property 2 a complete description of the property shall be listed on the inventory including any make model serial or owner identification number if applicable 3 police department records shall be examined to determine whether or not the property has been reported stolen or lost if the property has been reported stolen or lost and the identity of the owner is determined the police department shall contact the owner and advise him that the property is in the possession of the police department if the property is lost property the owner may claim the property at the police department 4 the police department shall consult the nciccib network if applicable to determine whether the property is lost or stolen 5 if the property is not reported lost or stolen and the value of the property exceeds $20000 the police department shall send a teletype message to area police agencies with a description of the property 6 property in the custody of the police department shall be stored and secured in the manner determined and ordered by the chief of police 7 if the property is perishable reasonable efforts shall be made to keep the property from spoiling 8 if the property is flammable explosive or incendiary great care shall be taken in storing the property 9 the police department may safely dispose of abandoned or unclaimed flammable explosive or incendiary substances materials or devices posing a danger to life or property in storage transportation or use immediately after taking possession of the substances materials or devices without following the procedures set forth in this section disposal shall be by the safest means possible with due regard for the safety of life property and the environment the milwaukee police department milwaukee county sheriffs department bomb squad or any other state or federal agency may be contacted to dispose of such substances materials or devices at the discretion of the police chief 10 subject to the provisions of wis stats  96820 the police department may dispose of firearms or ammunition without a public auction one year after taking possession if the owner has not requested their return if the firearms or ammunition appear to be stolen or are reported stolen every attempt should be made to return them to their rightful owner at such time as the property is no longer being held as evidence the disposal shall be by return to the rightful owner destruction or transfer to the state crime laboratory the division of law enforcement services or the department of justice federal bureau of investigation or the alcohol tobacco and firearms bureau of the us department of treasury pursuant to the provisions of wis stats   11 controlled substances or contraband that has been seized or recovered will be disposed of with the approval of the chief of police and the district attorney disposal of controlled substances will be at the city of waukesha incinerator in the presence of the property custodian and the chief of police or his designee intoxicating beverages will be disposed of by the property custodian by means of the village sewerage system 12 property seized as evidence and remaining in the hands of the police department for more than 90 days after the conclusion of all legal proceedings to which the property relates shall be deemed abandoned andor unclaimed property and shall be disposed of according to the provisions of this article  151988  v 9182007 article vi  public records definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning the definitions of the public records statute wis stats  1932 are adopted by reference in this section as if fully set forth and shall apply to this article custodian means that officer department head division head or employee of the village of pewaukee designated under section  or otherwise responsible by law to keep and preserve any village records or file deposit or keep such records in his office or is lawfully in possession or entitled to possession of such public records and who is required by this article to respond to requests for access to such records 1 1181983 cross reference definitions and rules of construction generally   duty to maintain records a except as provided under section  each officer and employee of the village of pewaukee shall safely keep and preserve all records received from his predecessor or other persons and required by law to be filed deposited or kept in his office or which are in the lawful possession or control of the officer or employee or his deputies or to the possession or control of which he may be lawfully entitled as such officer or employee b upon the expiration of an officers term of office or an employees term of employment or whenever the office or position of employment becomes vacant each such officer or employee shall deliver to his successor all records then in his custody  and the successor shall receipt to the officer or employee who shall file the receipt with the clerktreasurer if a vacancy occurs before a successor is selected or qualifies such records shall be delivered to and receipted for by the clerktreasurer on behalf of the successor to be delivered to such successor upon the latters receipt 2 1181983 legal custodian a the clerktreasurer or in his absence or disability or in case of vacancy the deputy clerk is designated the legal custodian of all village of pewaukee records except those records made kept preserved or maintained by the police department police commission and library board  and in the case of each aforementioned excepted authority the chief administrative officer of the authority shall be the legal custodian of that authoritys records and each legal custodian shall name a person to act as legal custodian in his absence b the legal custodian shall have full legal power to render decisions and to carry out the duties of an authority under wis stats  1921 et seq and this article the designation of a legal custodian does not affect the powers and duties of an authority under this article 3 1181983 public access to records a except as provided in section  any person has a right to inspect a record and to make or receive a copy of any record as provided in wis stats  19351 b records will be available for inspection and copying during all regular office hours c a requester shall be permitted to use facilities comparable to those available to village of pewaukee employees to inspect copy or abstract a record d the legal custodian may require supervision during inspection or may impose other reasonable restrictions on the manner of access to an original record if the record is irreplaceable or easily damaged e a requester shall be charged a fee in advance to defray the cost of locating and copying records as follows 1 the cost of photocopying shall be set by the village board this cost has been calculated not to exceed the actual necessary and direct cost of reproduction 2 if the form of a written record does not permit copying the actual and necessary cost of photographing and photographic processing shall be charged 3 the actual full cost of providing a copy of other records not in printed form on paper such as film computer printouts and audiotapes or videotapes shall be charged 4 if mailing or shipping is necessary the actual cost shall also be charged 5 there shall be no charge for locating a record unless the actual cost exceeds $5000 in which case the actual cost shall be determined by the legal custodian and billed to the requester 6 the legal custodian shall estimate the cost of all applicable fees and shall require a cash deposit adequate to assure payment if such estimate exceeds $500 7 elected and appointed officials of the village shall not be required to pay for public records they may reasonably require for the proper performance of their official duties f pursuant to wis stats  1934 and the guidelines listed in that section each authority for which the clerktreasurer is the legal custodian of the records pursuant to section a shall prominently display and make available for inspection and copying at the village hall for the guidance of the public a notice containing a description of its organization and a copy of this article and each excepted authority within the meaning of section a shall prominently display and make available for inspection and copying at the village hall a notice containing a description of its organization and the established times and places at which the legal custodian from whom and the methods whereby the public may obtain information and access to records in its custody make requests for records or obtain copies of records and the costs 4 1181983 access procedures a a request to inspect or copy a record shall be made to the legal custodian a request shall be deemed sufficient if it reasonably describes the requested record or the information requested however a request for a record without a reasonable limitation as to subject matter or length of time represented by the record does not constitute a sufficient request a request may be made orally but a request must be in writing before an action to enforce the request is commenced under wis stats  1937 except as otherwise provided no request may be refused because the person making the request is unwilling to be identified or to state the purpose of the request no request may be refused because the request is received by mail unless prepayment of a fee is required under section e6 a requester may be required to show acceptable identification whenever the requested record is kept at a private residence or whenever security reasons or federal law or regulations so require b the legal custodian upon request for any record shall as soon as practicable and without delay either fill the request or notify the requester of the authoritys determination to deny the request in whole or in part and the reasons for such denial if the legal custodian determines that a written request is so general as to be unduly time consuming the party making the request may first be required to itemize his request in a manner that would permit reasonable compliance c a request for a record may be denied as provided in section  if a request is made orally the request may be denied orally unless a demand for a written statement of the reasons denying the request is made by the requester within five business days of the oral denial if a written request is denied in whole or in part the requester shall receive a written statement of the reasons for denying the request every written denial of a request shall inform the requester that if the request for the record was made in writing the determination is subject to review upon petition for a writ of mandamus under wis stats  19371 or upon application to the attorney general or a district attorney 5 1181983 limitations on right to access a exemptions as provided by wis stats  1936 the following records are exempt from inspection under this article 1 records specifically exempted from disclosure by state or federal law or authorized to be exempted from disclosure by state law  2 any record relating to investigative information obtained for law enforcement purposes if federal law or regulations require exemption from disclosure or if exemption from disclosure is a condition to receipt of aids by the state  3 computer programs although the material used as input for a computer program or the material produced as a product of the computer program is subject to inspection  and 4 a record or any portion of a record containing information qualifying as a common law trade secret b public library records as provided by wis stats  4330 public library records are exempt from inspection under this article c denial in responding to a request for inspection or copying of a record not specifically exempt from disclosure the legal custodian may deny the request in whole or in part only if he determines that the harm to the public interest resulting from disclosure would outweigh the public interest in full access to the requested record examples of matters for which disclosure may be refused include but are not limited to the following 1 records obtained under official pledges of confidentiality which were necessary and given in order to obtain the information contained in them 2 records of current deliberations after a quasijudicial hearing 3 records of current deliberations concerning employment dismissal promotion demotion compensation performance or discipline of any village of pewaukee officer or employee or the investigation of charges against a village officer or employee unless such officer or employee consents to such disclosure 4 records concerning current strategy for crime detection or prevention 5 records of current deliberations or negotiations on the purchase of village property investing of village funds or other village business whenever competitive or bargaining reasons require nondisclosure 6 financial medical social or personal histories or disciplinary data of specific persons which if disclosed would be likely to have a substantial adverse effect upon the reputation of any person referred to in such history or data 7 communications between legal counsel for the village and any officer agent or employee of the village when advice is being rendered concerning strategy with respect to current litigation in which the village or any of its officers agents or employees is or is likely to become involved or communications privileged under wis stats  90503 d records containing both exempt and nonexempt material if a record contains information that may be made public and information that may not be made public the legal custodian of the record shall provide the information that may be made public and delete the information that may not be made public from the record before release if in the judgment of the legal custodian there is no feasible way to separate the exempt material from the nonexempt material without unreasonably jeopardizing nondisclosure of the exempt material the entire record shall be withheld from disclosure e contractors records each authority shall make available for inspection and copying under wis stats  19351 any record produced or collected under a contract entered into by the authority with a person other than an authority to the same extent as if the record were maintained by the authority this subsection does not apply to the inspection or copying of a record under wis stats  19351am f identities of applicants for public positions 1 in this section final candidate means each applicant for a position who is seriously considered for appointment or whose name is certified for appointment and whose name is submitted for final consideration to an authority for appointment to any state position except a position in the classified service or to any local public office as defined in wis stats  19427w final candidate includes whenever there are at least five candidates for an office or position each of the five candidates who are considered most qualified for the office or position by an authority and whenever there are less than five candidates for an office or position each such candidate whenever an appointment is to be made from a group of more than five candidates final candidate also includes each candidate in the group 2 every applicant for a position with any authority may indicate in writing to the authority that the applicant does not wish the authority to reveal his identity except with respect to a final candidate if an applicant makes such an indication in writing the authority shall not provide access to any record related to the application that may reveal the identity of the applicant g identities of law enforcement informants 1 in this subsection a informant means an individual who requests confidentiality from a law enforcement agency in conjunction with providing information to that agency or pursuant to an express promise of confidentiality by a law enforcement agency or under circumstances in which a promise of confidentiality would reasonably be implied provides information to a law enforcement agency or is working with a law enforcement agency to obtain information related in any case to any of the following 1 another person who the individual or the law enforcement agency suspects has violated is violating or will violate a federal law a law of any state or an ordinance of any local government 2 past present or future activities that the individual or law enforcement agency believes may violate a federal law a law of any state or an ordinance of any local government b law enforcement agency has the meaning given in wis stats  165831b and includes the department of corrections 2 if an authority that is a law enforcement agency receives a request to inspect or copy a record or portion of a record under wis stats  19351a that contains specific information including but not limited to a name address telephone number voice recording or handwriting sample which if disclosed would identify an informant the authority shall delete the portion of the record in which the information is contained or if no portion of the record can be inspected or copied without identifying the informant shall withhold the record unless the legal custodian of the record designated under wis stats  1933 makes a determination at the time the request is made that the public interest in allowing a person to inspect copy or receive a copy of such identifying information outweighs the harm done to the public interest by providing such access 6 1181983 destruction of records a financial records village officers may destroy the following nonutility financial records of shorter period 1 old insurance policies 2 election notices 3 canceled registration cards d notice unless notice is waived by the state historical society at least 60 days notice shall be given the state historical society prior to the destruction of any record as provided by wis stats  19214a e recordings any tape recordings of a governmental meeting of the village may be destroyed erased or provided in wis stats  12551 015a   5171983 restrictions on granting licenses a location no retail class b liquor license shall be issued for premises less than 300 feet from any established public school parochial school hospital or church nor in any residence district such distance shall be measured via the shortest route along the highway from the closest point of the boundary of such school church or hospital to the closest entrance to such premises any premises shall be deemed to be included within a residence district if twothirds of the buildings within a radius of 300 feet are used exclusively for residence purposes or incidental uses b streetlevel premises a class b liquor license shall be issued only for that portion of a premises located on the street level this subsection shall not prohibit any hotel or motel holding a state permit from supplying beverages in the original containers to bona fide patrons in rooms rented by those patrons 014a b sanitary facilities  compliance with codes and regulations each premises for which a class b liquor license is granted must be connected with village water and sewerage facilities must be properly lighted and ventilated and supplied with separate sanitary toilet and lavatory facilities equipped with running water for each sex and must in all respects comply with all village and state zoning building and housing codes and regulations 014d division 4  operators license required no premises operating under a class a b or c liquor license or permit may be open for business for purposes authorized under said license or permit unless there is on the premises a licensee or permittee the agent named on the license or permit if the licensee or permittee is a corporation or some person who has an operators license and who is responsible for the acts of all persons selling or serving any fermented malt beverages intoxicating liquor or wine to customers for the purposes of this section any member of the licensees immediate family who has attained the age of 18 shall be considered the holder of an operators license no person including a member of the licensee or pemittees immediate family other than the licensee or permittee or agent may serve fermented malt beverages intoxicating liquor or wine in any place operated under a class a b or c license or permit unless the permit has an operators license or is at least 18 years of age and is under the direct and immediate supervision of the licensee permittee agent or person holding an operators license who is on the premises at the time of service a  i 711974  i 642013 issuance of provisional operators license pursuant to state law a issuance of operators licenses an operators license may be issued to permit the operator to dispense fermented malt beverages intoxicating liquor or wine pursuant to wis stats  12517 in an establishment which possesses a class a or b retailers license otherwise permitting such activity any member of the immediate family and household of a retail licensee 21 years or older shall be considered as holding an operators license so long as he or she is working only on the family premises an underage member of the immediate family and household of the retail licensee may perform the duties of an operator if he or she is at least 18 years of age is only working on the family premises and is under the immediate supervision of any of the following persons who must be on the premises at the time of service a licensee an agent a class b manager a person holding an operators license or a member of the immediate family and household who is at least 21 years of age no person other than the licensee the aforementioned members of the licensees family and household a class b manager or a licensed operator or a person under the immediate supervision of the licensee certain members of the licensees family and household as noted above an agent or person holding an operators license who is on the premises at the time of service shall function as an operator pursuant to wis stats  12517 an application for a license shall be made to the village clerk all information submitted in writing to the village clerk in support of the application shall be true a background check of the applicant shall be performed by the village police department and in order to receive an operators license the applicant must be found not to have been charged with or convicted of any felony misdemeanor or other offense the circumstances of which substantially relate to the activities permitted under the operators license the applicant must further furnish evidence that the applicant has complied with the requirements set forth in wis stats  12517 the applicant shall further be required to pay the license fee b provisional operators license the provisional operators license shall authorize the operator to perform those activities permitted by the person holding the standard operators license set forth in subsection a above except as otherwise provided hereunder a provisional operators license shall expire 60 days after its issuance or when a standard operators license is issued to the holder whichever is sooner provisional operators licenses may not be renewed an application for a provisional operators license shall be made to the village clerk and must meet the standards as set forth in subsection a above provisional operators licenses may only be issued if the applicant has also applied for a standard operators license the applicant has complied with the standards as otherwise set forth in wis stats  12517 as well as subsection a above the applicant has not been denied a class b manager or operators license or has not had his or her class b or operators license not renewed or revoked within the preceding 12 months the applicant provides evidence that he or she otherwise meets the requirements of wis stats  12517 or is currently enrolled in responsible beverage server training course the village clerk shall issue a provisional operators license to an applicant who at the time of application for the operators license files with the village a certified copy of a valid operators license issued by another municipality a provisional license issued under this section expires as provided above or upon expiration of the operators license issued by another municipality and filed under this section whichever is sooner the village clerk may revoke the provisional license issued under this paragraph if the village clerk determines that the operators license issued by another municipality and filed under this paragraph is not valid or upon the denial of the holders application for a class d operators license or if the applicant fails to successfully complete the training course for responsible beverage service c special temporary operators license a special temporary operators license shall permit the holder to perform those activities permitted under subsection a above but only for religious scientific educational benevolent or other nonprofit corporations or associations of individuals not conducted for pecuniary profit this license may be only issued to operators employed by or donating their services to nonprofit entities no person may hold more than one license of this kind per year application for special temporary operators license shall be made to the village clerk in writing on forms as supplied by the village clerk the application shall be signed and sworn to by the applicant and shall note the premises upon which the applicant will be working and the date or dates of the specific event not exceeding 14 consecutive days sponsored by the organization the applicant shall be subject to the same background check process noted in subsection a above the village clerk shall issue the special temporary operators license upon payment of the license fee  1231991  ii 642013 division 5  license fees charged the following fees shall be charged for licenses license $4000 operator licensenew $4000 operator licenserenewal $4000 012   1071980   951989  a 12313 article iii  nudity and sexual conduct prohibited in establishments dealing in alcohol beverages footnotes  3  cross reference adultoriented establishments   et seq legislative authorization this article is enacted in the interest of the public health peace safety morals and general welfare of the citizens and inhabitants of the village of pewaukee pursuant to the state constitution and laws of the state and the authority of the village and exercising its right to regulate the sale and consumption of alcohol beverages pursuant to the 21st amendment to the constitution of the united states findings of fact the village board finds that evidence has been propounded that indicates that nudity and sexual conduct and their depiction coupled with alcohol in public places begets undesirable behavior and that prostitution attempted rape rape murder and assaults on police officers have occurred in and around establishments dealing in alcohol beverages where nude and sexual conduct and their depiction is permitted intent a it is found that the acts prohibited in section  encourage the conduct of prostitution attempted rape rape murder and assaults on police officers in and around establishments dealing in alcohol beverages that actual and simulated nudity and sexual conduct and their depiction coupled with alcohol in public places begets undesirable behavior and conduct among patrons and employees with establishments dealing in alcohol beverages which results in violation of law and dangers to the health safety and welfare of the public b it is the intent of this article to prohibit nudity gross sexuality and their simulation and depiction in establishments dealing in alcohol beverages definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning alcohol beverages means all beverages containing more than one percent of alcohol by weight establishment dealing in alcohol beverages means any business or commercial establishment whether open to the public at large or where entrance is limited by cover charge or membership requirement including those licensed by the state for sale andor service of alcohol beverages and any bottle club  hotel  motel  restaurant  nightclub  country club  cabaret  meeting facility utilized by any religious social fraternal or similar organization  business or commercial establishment where a product or article is sold dispensed served or provided with the knowledge actual or implied that they will be or is intended to be mixed combined with or drunk in connection or combination with an alcohol beverage on the premises of such business or commercial establishment  or business or commercial establishment where the consumption of alcohol beverages is permitted a private residence whether permanent or temporary in nature is not an establishment dealing in alcohol beverages cross reference definitions and rules of construction generally   prohibited acts a no person shall expose to public view his genitals pubic area vulva anus anal cleft or cleavage or buttocks or their simulation in an establishment dealing in alcohol beverages b no female person shall expose to public view any portion of her breast below the top of the areola or their simulation in the establishment dealing in alcohol beverages c no person maintaining owning or operating an establishment dealing in alcohol beverages shall suffer or permit any person to expose to public view his genitals pubic area vulva anus anal cleft or cleavage or buttocks or their simulation within the establishment dealing in alcohol beverages d no person maintaining owning or operating an establishment dealing in alcohol beverages shall suffer or permit any female person to expose to public view any portion of her breasts below the top of the areola or their simulation within the establishment dealing in alcohol beverages e no person shall engage in and no person maintaining owning or operating an establishment dealing in alcohol beverages shall suffer or permit any sexual intercourse masturbation sodomy bestiality oral copulation flagellation any sexual act prohibited by law touching caressing fondling of the breasts buttocks anus or genitals or their simulation within an establishment dealing in alcohol beverages f no person shall cause and no person maintaining owning or operating an establishment dealing in alcohol beverages shall suffer or permit the exposition of any graphic representation including pictures or the projection of film that depicts human genitals pubic area vulva anus anal cleft or cleavage buttocks female breasts below the top of the areola sexual intercourse masturbation sodomy bestiality oral copulation flagellation any sexual act prohibited by law touching caressing or fondling of the breasts buttocks anus or genitals or their simulation within any establishment dealing in alcohol beverages article iv  tavern dance halls license required no person licensed to sell intoxicating liquors or fermented malt beverages in the village of pewaukee shall offer suffer or permit in the place for which any such license is granted any dancing whether public or private without having first procured a tavern dance hall license as provided in this article 1 zoning area restrictions no tavern dance hall license shall be issued to any person licensed to sell intoxicating liquors or fermented malt beverages at retail in the place for which such license is granted unless such place is located in a commercial business or manufacturing district as defined in the village of pewaukee zoning person to whom a tavern dance hall license has been previously issued for a place that is not located in the abovementioned districts shall be regarded as a nonconforming license holder and shall be entitled to a tavern dance hall license upon application provided all other requirements of village ordinances are fulfilled 2 floor space requirements no tavern dance hall license shall be issued unless such premises have 250 or more square feet of floor area available for dancing space 4 application a applications for a tavern dance hall license shall be filed with the clerktreasurer for presentation to the village board the application shall state the 1 name and address of the applicant  2 location at which such tavern dance hall is intended to be conducted  3 name of the person or company owning the premises for which the license is asked  and 4 type of license issued for such premises to sell intoxicating liquor or fermented malt beverages at retail all such applications shall be accompanied by a receipt of the clerktreasurer showing deposit with him of the license fee b when such deposit is made with the clerktreasurer he shall issue a receipt stating the amount of the deposit and the purpose for which it was made such receipt shall be attached to the application the deposit on all applications denied by the village board or withdrawn by the applicant shall be refunded by the clerktreasurer to the applicant when a license is granted by the village board the clerktreasurer shall apply such deposit as full payment of the license applied for and granted 6 investigation and issuance no tavern dance hall license shall be issued unless such hall complies with all ordinances health and fire regulations of the village of pewaukee and of waukesha county and the state of wisconsin and is properly ventilated and supplied with sufficient toilet conveniences and is a safe and proper place for the purpose for which it is proposed to be used 7 premises regulated a village of pewaukee tavern dance hall license shall entitle the holder to permit dancing upon such licensed premises a special onenight license may be issued by the chief of police at a fee of $1000 for each night such location shall comply with all other requirements of this chapter except the square foot requirements of section  may be reduced to 200 square feet 023   951989 nonassignability of license licenses granted under this article shall not be assignable 023   951989 fee and expiration the fee for a tavern dance hall license shall be $10000 such license shall expire on june 30 following date of issuance 025   951989 investigation fee at the time of filing the application for a tavern dance hall license a fee of $500 shall be paid to the clerktreasurer to cover the cost of investigation of the facts stated in the application 033k   951989 closing hours all dancing and instrumental music conducted under the authority of a license issued pursuant to this article shall be discontinued between  am and  am on weekdays and  am and  am on sundays and legal holidays there shall be no restriction to music on january 1 of each year 8 revocation of license any licenses issued pursuant to this article shall be forfeited or revoked by the village board where the licensee permits disorderly or immoral conduct on the premises and shall stand revoked without further proceedings upon the conviction of the licensee for maintaining a disorderly riotous indecent or improper house a licensees premises shall include all areas outside the tavern building used in connection with the building and which are controlled or are part of the real estate upon which such tavern dance hall is situated if a license issued pursuant to this article shall be forfeited or revoked at least six months shall elapse before another such license shall be granted on the same premises to the same licensee 9 provisional retailer licenses the village clerk may issue upon application a provisional retailer license to a person who has applied for a retail license for the sale of fermented malt beverages intoxicating liquor or wine such provisional license shall only authorize those activities that the type of retail license applied for authorizes and shall be subject to the applicant meeting all licensing requirements set forth in this chapter and wis stats   the provisional license shall expire 60 days after its issuance or when the alcohol beverage retail establishment license is issued to the holder whichever is sooner such provisional licenses may not be renewed and may be revoked by the village clerk if the clerk determines that a false statement was made on the application the issuance of a provisional class b license is subject to the availability of the license based upon the quota limitations of wis stats  12551 i 8202013 animals footnotes  1  cross reference health and sanitation ch 38 article i  in general state statutes
