reference the state plumbing wisconsin being wis admin comm 8287  551981 division 2  connection charges footnotes  5  cross reference finance   et seq established a connection fee set by the village board shall be paid for each new water connection in the village this fee shall be levied for each residential equivalent unit a residential equivalent unit is defined as a singlefamily dwelling unit be that unit a singlefamily residence an apartment unit or a condominium unit for example a fourunit apartment would have four residential equivalent units residential equivalent units for nonresidential users shall be calculated as required by the village board 1311 581993 article iv  private wells division 1  generally penalties any well owner violating any provision of this article shall upon conviction be subject to a penalty as provided in section   10201987 relationship to plumbing code this article does not supersede the plumbing code adopted in section  but is supplementary to such code 10   551981 abandonment of private wells a purpose the purpose of this section is to prevent unused andor improperly constructed wells from serving as a passage for contaminated surface or nearsurface waters or other materials to reach usable groundwater  and private wells must be properly filled and sealed b all private wells located on premises served by the public water system of the village of pewaukee shall be properly filled after public water supply is connected to the premises unless a well operation permit has been granted by the village water commission the well operation permit may exempt the premises from connection to the municipal water system subject to the conditions of maintenance and operation as provided for in this section at such time as municipal water service is made available to a property connection shall promptly be made to said system unless the property owner obtains a well operation permit to allow for the continued use of their private well c well operation permits a permit may be granted to the well owner to operate a well for a period of five years if the requirements of this subsection are met said permit may be renewed for a like fiveyear period application shall be made on forms provided by the clerk treasurer 1 the well and pump installation meet the requirements of wis admin nr 812 and a well contractors report is on file with the department of natural resources or certification of the acceptability of the well has been granted by the private water supply section of the department of natural resources 2 the well has a history of producing safe water as evidenced by a current sampling result identifying the water as bacteriologically safe 3 the proposed use of the well can be justified as being necessary in addition to water provided by the public water system 4 no physical connection shall exist between the piping of the public water system and the private well d methods wells to be abandoned shall be filled according to the procedures outlined in wis admin nr 812 the pump and piping must be removed and the well checked for obstructions prior to plugging any obstructions or liner must be removed e reports and inspections a well abandonment report must be submitted by the well owner to the department of natural resources on forms provided by that agency available at the office of the clerktreasurer the report shall be submitted immediately upon completion of the filling of the well the filling must be observed by a representative of the village  10201987  iiii 3212006 division 2  cross connections definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this division shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning cross connection means any physical connection or arrangement between two otherwise separate systems one of which contains potable water from the village of pewaukee water system and the other water from a private source water of unknown or questionable safety or steam gases or chemicals whereby there may be a flow from one system to the other the direction of flow depending on the pressure differential between the two systems  551981 cross reference definitions and rules of construction generally   prohibited no person shall establish or permit to be established or maintain or permit to be maintained any cross connection no interconnection shall be established whereby potable water from a private auxiliary or emergency water supply other than the regular public water supply of the village of pewaukee may enter the supply or distribution system of the village unless such private auxiliary or emergency water supply and the method of connection and use of such supply shall have been approved by the village water utility and by the wisconsin department of natural resources in accordance with wis admin codes nr 81107  551981  i 12162014 inspections authorized it shall be the duty of the village of pewaukee water utility to cause inspections to be made of all properties served by the public water system where cross connection with the public water system is deemed possible the frequency of inspections and reinspections based on potential health hazards involved shall be as established by the water utility and as approved by the wisconsin department of natural resources in accordance with wis admin codes nr 810151c  551981  i 12162014 right of entry of water utility personnel upon presentation of credentials a representative of the village of pewaukee water utility shall have the right to request entry at any reasonable time to examine any property served by a connection to the public water system of the village for cross connections if entry is refused such representative shall obtain a special inspection warrant under wis stats   on request the owner lessee or occupant of any property so served shall furnish to the inspection agency any pertinent information regarding the piping system on such property  551981 discontinuance of service authorized a the village of pewaukee water utility is authorized and directed to discontinue water service to any property wherein any connection in violation of this division exists and to take such other precautionary measures deemed necessary to eliminate any danger of contamination of the public water system water service shall be discontinued only after reasonable notice and opportunity for hearing under wis stats ch 68 except as provided in subsection b of this section water service to such property shall not be restored until the cross connection has been eliminated in compliance with the provisions of this division b if it is determined by the water utility that a cross connection or an emergency endangers public health safety or welfare and requires immediate action and a written finding to that effect is filed with the clerktreasurer and delivered to the customers premises service may be immediately discontinued the customer shall have an opportunity for hearing under wis stats ch 68 within ten days of such emergency discontinuance  6 551981 storm water utility footnotes  1  editors note  adopted mar 20 200 amended ch 91 to read as herein set out former ch 91   pertained to similar subject matter and derived from  adopted oct 3 2006 general operation the management of storm water and other surface water discharges within the village of pewaukee is a matter that impacts the public health safety and welfare of the residents and occupants of the village of pewaukee failure to effectively manage storm water effects the sanitary sewer utility operations of the village by amongst other things increasing infiltration and inflow to the sanitary sewer system in addition surface water runoff creates erosions of land and damage to businesses and residences and creates sedimentation and other environmental damage within the village in order to protect the public health safety and welfare the village of pewaukee is exercising its authority to establish a storm water utility pursuant to wis stats chs 62 and 66 including but not limited to sections 6204 6211 6216  6218    and  the storm water utility may acquire construct lease own operate maintain extend expand replace clean dredge repair conduct manage and finance such facilities as deemed by the utility to be proper and reasonably necessary for a system of storm and surface water management these facilities may include but not be limited to surface and underground drainage facilities sewers water retaining wells and ponds inverts and such other facilities as will support a storm water management system the daytoday oversight of the storm water utility shall be performed by the village administrator and the director of public works committee oversight of the utility operations shall fall under the public works and safety committee which shall serve as an advisory committee to the village board on all matters relating to the storm water utility  3202007 definitions for the purpose of this chapter the following terms phrases words and their derivations shall have the meaning given herein monthly utility revenue the utility revenue is the estimated monthly expenditures for planning and inventories capital expenditures personnel and equipment and operation of the storm water utility in accordance with established village of pewaukee policy storm water utility fee the storm water utility fee is defined as the annual charge developed for each parcel of land utility factor the utility factor is defined as the ratio of runoff volume in inches for a particular land use zoning classification based upon the current actual land use of the property to the runoff volume in inches for an average singlefamily residential assuming a twoinch rainfall and natural resources conservation services nrcs type b soil conditions for properties containing multiple uses ie commercial and residential the underlying zoning districtland use classification will be used to determine the appropriate utility factor for the storm water fee calculation  3202007 storm water utility factors the storm water utility fee shall be determined by first determining the percentage of total runoff in the village of pewaukee which is attributed to singlefamily residential property the peracre fee for all other individual parcels shall be defined as the product of the singlefamily residential peracre fee the appropriate utility factor and the total acreage of the parcel singlefamily residential parcels shall be assessed on a per household basis the utility factors for various land uses are shown in the following table this calculation is based upon a storm water utility feasibility study prepared by short elliott hendrickson inc for the village of pewaukee in january 2006 classification land usezoning district utility factor 1 singlefamily residential r1 to r5 zoning districts 100 2 multifamily residential r6 rm and mh zoning districts 192 3 community commercial b1 to b3 zoning districts 423 4 industrialbusiness park b4 or b5 zoning districts 330 5 institutional ips zoning district 330 6 environmental undeveloped lands within fw fc c1 and c2 zoning districts as set forth in the village zoning  exempt 7 parkopen space p1 zoning district exempt 8 public road rightofway exempt 9 open water exempt 10 undeveloped platted subdivision outlots exempt  3202007 credits information to justify a fee adjustment must be supplied by the property owner using a form application to be prepared by the village administrator such adjustments of fees shall not be retroactive credits will be reviewed regularly by a staff committee the storm water utility provides for credits for the use of wisconsin dnr approved storm water best management practices bmps such as storm water basins green space undeveloped land etc credits must be applied for by december 15 of year preceding the year in which the credit is to be considered the amount of the credit will be determined by the village engineer and approved by the village board a property owner may appeal to the village board regarding a determination of the credit once per calendar year 1 commercial industrial institutional a credit may be granted to a commercial industrial or institutional parcel that can demonstrate a minimum of 20 percent of the amount of storm water leaving the parcel via the use of an approved wi dnr storm water best management practice bmp credits can be combined to account for a total reduction of up to 75 percent of the storm water utility fee documentation must be provided to the village for evaluation of the claim it is strongly suggested that the documentation be prepared by a professional engineer licensed in the state of wisconsin and provide the necessary drawings and calculations to support the claim it is the applicants responsibility to prove the claim 2 examples of best management practices a storm water detention basins retention and infiltration systems grassed swales and drainage from impervious areas into grassed surfaces may be eligible for a credit only if the water from the basins or swales is discharged to the villages municipal separate storm sewer system ms4 at the predevelopment rate as outlined in the villages storm water ordinance b credits may be given to a parcel that is infiltrating storm water from roof structures into approved rain garden designs consideration will be given to structures that are discharging to grass areas direct discharge from roof or from a gutter system if the grass area is of a sufficient size to handle the volume is not steeply graded and has appropriate soils type a b or c for infiltration gutter systems discharging to impervious surfaces such as clay soils parking lots or plastic lined landscaping are not eligible for this credit  50 percent to 75 percent of roof surface discharging to infiltration area 20 percent credit  76 percent to 90 percent of roof surface discharging to infiltration area 25 percent credit  91 percent to 100 percent of roof surface discharging to infiltration area 50 percent credit c credits may be given to a parcel where the parking lot is graded to sheet storm water off into a pervious surface such as grass rain garden or wooded area if the area is of a sufficient size to handle the volume is not steeply graded and has appropriate soils type a b or c for infiltration curb cut parking lot designs may also be considered but must be documented by a pe for their design effectiveness  25 percent to 50 percent discharge to a pervious surface 25 percent credit  51 percent to 100 percent discharge to a pervious surface 50 percent credit d engineered rain garden parking lots engineered to meet the storm water ordinance requirements of a twoinch rain are strongly encouraged and can be granted a credit of up to the maximum credit 75 percent if the design treats 75 percent or more of the total storm water volume generated on the parcel storm water from buildings must also be considered 3 land use credits a vacant land credit vacant land meeting the following criteria is to be excluded from the area used to calculate the monthly charge 1 the property must not be developed in any way or have been developed in the past ten years the property must reflect land in an undisturbed natural state with nonimpacted soils ie the soils are not compacted 2 the vacant land must represent at least 50 percent of the total parcel or be one acre or more in size 3 vacant land does not include green space as outlined below b green space credit green space areas meeting the following criteria can receive up to a 75 percent reduction from the area used to calculate the monthly charge 1 green spaces shall be contiguous pervious vegetated areas incorporated into the developed parcel 2 the space shall not have more than 25 percent impacted compacted soils examples of impacted spaces are trails ball fields gravesites and picnic areas 3 green space must be 20 feet or more away from the nearest impervious surface or structure 4 the green space must be a minimum of one acre in size and not less than 25 percent of the total parcel 5 grassed parking areas that are utilized more than 15 days per year are excluded from the green space credit as these are impacted compacted soils  3202007 exemptions the following land uses are exempt from the storm water management fee 1 environmental undeveloped lands within floodway floodplain and conservancy zoning classifications as set forth in the village zoning  2 parkopen space p1 park zoning 3 public road rightofway 4 undeveloped platted subdivision outlots 5 open water  3202007 payment of fee storm water utility fees shall be billed to the storm water utility customer at the same time and in the same manner as the water and sanitary sewer bills the property owner shall be ultimately responsible for the payment of the storm water utility charge a storm water utility charge shall be sent in a like manner to any property not taking service from the sanitary sewer or water utility the fee shall be due and payable under the same terms as water and sanitary sewer utility bills the failure to pay the storm water utility charges when due shall subject the property owner to such penalties as are established under state law andor by the village board and may result in the charges being assessed as a lien against the property pursuant to wis stats   and  any prepayment or overpayment of charges shall be retained by the village of pewaukee and applied against subsequent fees  3202007 appeal of fee a procedure for filing appeals 1 a written appeal shall be filed with the village administrator prior to the utility charge due date  or 2 within 30 days of payment a written challenge to the storm water charge must be filed with the village administrator on behalf of the customer specifying all bases for the challenge and the amount of the storm water charge the customer asserts is appropriate failure to file a challenge within 30 days of payment waives all right to later challenge the charge b the public works and safety committee shall review the appeals of storm water utility charges 1 the village administrator will coordinate the processing of all appeals and challenges and schedule the meetings of the review committee to assure that all appeals and challenges are processed within the times established by this chapter 2 the public works and safety committee shall meet no more often than once per month to review appeals and challenges and make a determination of whether the storm water charge is fair and reasonable or whether a refund is due the customer c the customer has 30 days from the decision of the review committee to file a written appeal to the village board d if the village board or public works and safety committee determines that a refund is due the customer the refund will be applied as a credit on the customers next quarterly storm water billing if the refund will not exceed the customers next quarterly storm water billing or will be refunded at the discretion of the village clerktreasurer  3202007 penalty for late payment the penalty for late payment shall be addressed as provided in wis stats    3202007 effective date for storm water utility the utility shall be created and in effect on   3202007 vehicles for hire footnotes  1  cross reference businesses ch 18  streets sidewalks and other public places ch 78  traffic and vehicles ch 86 article i  in general reserved article ii  taxicabs footnotes  2  state law reference insurance requirements generally wis stats  344012d  on human service vehicles wis stats  34455  authority to license wis stats  34924 division 1  generally definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning taxicab means all vehicles transporting passengers for remuneration for which patronage is solicited publicly this definition shall not apply to 1 vehicles operating on established routes which are regulated by the public service commission 2 vehicles that have been licensed by any other city or village as taxicabs and which have not remained in the village of pewaukee continually for at least five days 071a b cross reference definitions and rules of construction generally   taxicabs to be marked every taxicab shall be distinctly marked on two sides in letters not less than 112 inches in height with the words taxi or taxicab together with the licensees name 077 division 2  license required no person shall for remuneration transport passengers in a taxicab within the corporate limits of the village of pewaukee without first having obtained a taxicab license for such taxicab 072 application a application for a taxicab license to operate one or more taxicabs or an application to operate additional taxicabs under an existing license shall be made in writing to the clerktreasurer giving the address from which the business is conducted and shall be signed by the owner of the business or his duly authorized agent the application must state for each vehicle to be operated the make model and year of manufacture the engine number serial number and capacity for passengers and the certificate of title number and license number b the application shall be submitted by the clerktreasurer to the village board at its next regular meeting the village board or a committee of the board appointed for such purpose shall thereafter on or before the next regular meeting of the board hold a public hearing on each application to determine if the public convenience and necessity will be served by the granting of such taxicab license and to determine if the equipment of the applicant will meet the requirements of wis stats ch 347 at least five days prior to the date set for the hearing notice shall be given to the applicant by the clerktreasurer together with the time and place of the hearing at least five days prior to the hearing notice of the time and place of the meeting shall be posted in at least three public places within the village c before the village board or committee shall recommend the issuance of a taxicab license it shall consider the following factors 1 whether or not the public convenience and necessity require such proposed taxicab service  2 the financial responsibility of the applicant and the likelihood of the proposed services being permanent responsible and satisfactory  3 the number and condition of the units of the applicants equipment  4 the schedule of rates proposed by the applicant  5 the number of cabs if any and the effect of additional cabs upon traffic conditions  6 the experience of the applicant in the taxicab business  and 7 such other related facts as may be deemed advisable and necessary d if the hearing is held by the committee it shall recommend the granting or refusal of the application  and the recommendation shall be reported to the village board within ten days after the hearing no license shall be granted until the village board shall determine that the public convenience and necessity will be served by the service proposed in the application for license in any event the board shall grant or refuse the application within 60 days after the public hearing upon the application 073 license fees the taxicab license fee shall be as set by the village board per year or any fractional part of a year for the first vehicle operated and as set by the village board per year or any fractional part of a year for each additional vehicle operated by the same license the license year shall begin july 1 and end june 30 if less than six months remain of the license year the license fee for the first taxicab shall be reduced by half 074   951989 insurance a no taxicab license shall be issued until the applicant deposits with the clerktreasurer a policy of liability insurance covering all vehicles to be included under the license such policy shall describe each vehicle by make model and serial number  number of passengers capable of being accommodated at one time  and the number of the state motor vehicle license such policy shall be issued by a company licensed to do business in the state of wisconsin and shall insure the licensee against loss from liability to the amounts required by wis stats ch 344 b the insurance policy shall be approved by the village attorney as to legal form before it is filed and shall contain a provision that it may not be canceled before the expiration of its term except upon ten days written notice to the village c the cancellation or other termination of any policy of insurance issued in compliance with this section shall automatically revoke and terminate all licenses issued for the vehicles covered by such policy unless another policy shall have been filed and approved pursuant to this section at the time of such cancellation or termination 075 revocation the village board may revoke a taxicab license for failure of the licensee to maintain his equipment as provided by wis stats ch 347 or for more than three convictions for moving violations of traffic laws or ordinances within any sixmonth period by the licensee or by persons driving vehicles under such license or by conduct of the licensee or by persons driving vehicles under such license that is prejudicial to the public health safety or welfare of the village when any taxicab license is revoked the clerktreasurer shall immediately notify the licensee to cease immediately to operate the cab for which the license shall have been revoked 076 waters and beaches footnotes  1  cross reference land development ch 40  parks and recreation ch 58  planning ch 62  litter in lakes and fountains    streets sidewalks and other public places ch 78 state law reference navigable waters generally wis stats  3001 et seq article i  in general secs 98050  reserved article ii  pewaukee lake and dam footnotes  2  editors note 1 adopted  did not specifically amend this is treated as superseding the provisions of article ii comprised of   in their entirety formerly said sections pertained to similar subject matter and derived from 013  200116a  20011  200113  2005  2006  and 2004 respectively cross reference pewaukee lake regulations and agreements saved from repeal  12  vehicles on pewaukee lake   et seq intent the intent of this article and revisions hereto is to provide safe and healthful conditions for the enjoyment of aquatic recreation consistent with public rights and interest and the capability of pewaukee lake as a water resource  5152001 applicability and enforcement the provisions of this article shall apply to the waters of pewaukee lake within the jurisdiction of the town of delafield village of pewaukee or city of pewaukee the provisions of this article and wisconsin statutes when applicable shall be enforced by the officers of the water safety patrol unit of the village of pewaukee under the direction of the village of pewaukee police chief as the chief of the pewaukee lake water safety patrol the waukesha county sheriffs department and the wisconsin department of natural resources  5152001   4202010 state boating and water safety laws adopted the statutory provisions describing and defining regulations with respect to water traffic boats boating and related water activities in wis stats  3050 inclusive and as amended from time to time exclusive of any provisions therein relating to the penalties to be imposed or the punishment for violation of said statutes are hereby adopted and by reference made a part of this section as if fully set forth herein any act required to be performed or prohibited by the provisions of any statute incorporated herein by reference is required or prohibited by this article  5152001 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning designated mooring area means an area of water established and marked as a mooring area by lawful authority or with authorization from such authority per wis stats   navigation lane means an area designated by authorized aids to navigation personal flotation devices mean type ilife preserver jacket type type iibuoyant vest horse collar type type iiispecial purpose type ski vests fishermans vest or float coats type ivbuoyant cushions and ring buoys throwable devices not designed to be worn type vcoast guard approved suits when worn public access means any access to the water by means of authorized public property sensitive environmental areas mean waters of pewaukee lake or flowing into pewaukee lake designated and posted as sensitive environmental areas by the three authorizing communities based upon recommendations of the wisconsin department of natural resources with use restrictions posted by the communities based upon recommendation of the dnr shore zone means all surface water within 200 feet of any shore slownowake means the slowest possible speed so as to maintain steerage swimming zone means an authorized area marked by regulatory markers to designate a swimming area 8 5152001 speed restrictions speed limit unless limited by subsections 13 no person shall operate a watercraft at a speed in excess of 50 mph 1 weekend limits no person shall operate a watercraft at a speed in excess of 40 mph from 12 oclock noon to the published time of sunset on saturdays sundays and the following holidayslabor day memorial day 4th of july and any intervening day celebrated as part of the holiday 2 special limits no person shall at any time operate a watercraft or permit themself to be towed in excess of slownowake within 200 feet of any shore swimmer not in a designated swimming area marked public swimming area diving flag canoe rowboat sailboat nonoperating motor watercraft bridge public access designated anchorage or mooring area or sensitive environmental area 3 general limits no person shall operate a watercraft at a speed in excess of ten mph between the published time of sunset and one hour after sunrise on all waters of pewaukee lake  provided that this provision shall not apply to watercraft participating in permitted races over a course laid out plainly marked and adequately patrolled 3 5152001 capacity restrictions no person shall operate or loan rent or permit a watercraft to leave the place where it is customarily kept for operation on the waters with more passengers or cargo than a safe load  5152001 additional traffic rules in addition to the boating rules adopted in section  the following rules shall apply to watercrafts using the waters of pewaukee lake 1 houseboat unless specifically permitted by the water safety patrol watercraft with sanitary facilities living or camping facilities are prohibited 2 tie ups of watercraft unless specifically permitted by the water safety patrol prolonged anchoring mooring or drifting of nested watercrafts for more than two hours is hereby declared to be in conflict with the intent and purpose of the article and is hereby prohibited 2 5152001 moorings and stationary objects a moored and anchored objects no person shall erect or maintain any raft ski jump stationary platform or any other obstacles to navigation more than 200 feet from the shore at any time unless a permit is obtained from the chief of the water safety patrol all rafts andor obstacles herein described shall be so constructed or anchored so that it has at least six inches of free board above the water line to the extent possible painted white and has attached thereto not less than 12 inches from each side of each corner or projection a red reflector not less than three inches in diameter all such objects shall be inscribed with the name and address of the owner and marked per wis stats  3012 and 3013 b designated moorings the shore zone is designated a mooring zone except in areas of heavy traffic where mooring may be prohibited by order of the chief of the water safety patrol unless permitted by the chief of the water safety patrol mooring for more than 24 hours is prohibited other than by riparian owners or persons exercising riparian rights and as provided by the local community mooring of a watercraft other than an emergency craft is prohibited in swimming zones mooring for more than 24 hours is prohibited elsewhere on the lake c public accesses mooring or anchoring of watercraft at public accesses other than at piers as designated by the controlling governmental agency is prohibited d mooring lights required no person shall moor any unoccupied watercraft raft buoy or other floating object more than 200 feet from the shoreline between sunset and sunrise unless a permit has been obtained from the chief of the water safety patrol and there is prominently displayed thereon a white light of sufficient size and brightness to be visible from any direction for a distance of two miles on a dark night with a clear atmosphere this provision shall not apply to the shore zone objects moored in designated mooring areas or buoys marking race courses as provided herein e buoys marking race courses such buoys may be set without lighting provided that a permit has been obtained from the chief of the water safety patrol and that they are a bright color and are made of materials which will not damage a watercraft if struck f mooring buoys all mooring buoys placed on the waters of the lake must comply with regulations of the department of natural resources special permits shall be issued by the chief of the water safety patrol for temporary nonconforming buoys necessary during regattas and sporting events 6 5152001 safe operation required a no person shall operate direct or handle a watercraft in such a careless or negligent manner as to endanger the occupants of their or other watercraft b no watercraft shall be operated in a repetitive circular figure eight or other similar pattern in an area less than 300 feet in diameter and in a manner that creates a wake c in addition to the provisions of wis stats  3062 no person shall modify tamper or alter any watercraft or the original equipment of any watercraft which increases the standard operating decibel level of said watercraft in violation of wis stats  3062 d unless specifically permitted by the lake patrol no person shall operate direct or handle a motorized watercraft in a racing manner 4 5152001 swimming regulations a no person shall swim from any unmanned watercraft unless such watercraft is anchored b distance from shore no person shall swim more than 200 feet from the shore unless in a designated swimming zone or when accompanied by a competent person in a watercraft c hours limited no person shall swim more than 200 feet from the shoreline between sunset and one hour after sunrise 3 5152001 water skiing a distance from shore public accesses and beaches no person shall operate a watercraft for the purpose of towing a person on water skis aquaplane glider kite parachute or similar device or permit themself to be towed for such purpose within 200 feet of the shoreline outside limits of any swimming zone other watercraft any swimmer not in designated swimming area diving flag of any public access of any designated anchorage or mooring area or of any buoyedmarked race course b personal flotation device no person shall operate a watercraft for the purpose of towing a person on water skis aquaplane glider kite parachute or similar device or permit themself to be towed for such purpose unless the person being towed is wearing a type i ii iii or v personal flotation device c length of tow the maximum length of any tow rope for towing a person water skiing aquaplaning gliding kite flying parachuting or similar device shall be 75 feet d exceptions the limitations of this section shall not apply to participants in ski meets or exhibitions authorized and conducted as provided in section  4 5152001 races regattas sporting events and exhibitions a permit required no person shall direct or participate in any watercraft race regatta water ski meet or other water sporting event or exhibition unless such event has been authorized and a permit issued therefor by the chief of the water safety patrol b permit a permit issued under this section shall specify the course or any area of water to be used by participants in such events and the permittee shall be required to place markers flags or buoys approved by the chief of the water safety patrol designating the specific area or the general race course permits shall be issued only if in the opinion of the chief the proposed use of the water can be carried out safely and without danger to or substantial obstruction of other watercrafts or persons using the lake permits shall be valid only for the hours and areas specified thereon c rightofway participants watercraft and participants in any such permitted event shall have the rightofway on the marked area and no other person shall obstruct such area during the race or event or interfere therewith 3 5152001 marker and navigation aids posting ordinance a duty of chief the chief of the water safety patrol unit is authorized and directed to place authorized markers navigation aids and signs in such water areas as shall be appropriate to advise the public of the provisions of this article and to post and maintain a copy of this article at all public access points within the jurisdiction of the village of pewaukee the town of delafield the city of pewaukee and the county of waukesha b standard markers all markers placed by the chief of the water safety patrol or any other person upon the waters of the lake shall comply with the regulations of the department of natural resources c interference with markers prohibited no person shall without authority remove damage or destroy or moor or attach any raftwatercraft to any buoy beacon or marker place in the waters of the lake by the authority of the united states state county town city village or by any private person pursuant to the provisions of this article 3 5152001 emergencies when the elevation of the lake is in excess of 8534 above sea level as measured at the village of pewaukee dam no person shall operate a water craft in excess of slownowake in any area of the lake during any other period of emergency as determined by the chief the chief of the water safety patrol is authorized to impose speed limit restrictions or other reasonable restrictions regarding the use of pewaukee lake any period of speed limit restrictions shall be no less than 24 hours in duration lake patrol shall post restrictions at all public accesses  5152001 penalties and deposits any officer of the pewaukee lake water safety patrol has authority to issue citations and when warranted to arrest a person for violation of this article or applicable wisconsin statutes and shall either permit such person to make a money deposit as provided in an approved baildeposit schedule per wis stats  3080 or bring the person arrested before the municipal court for the village of pewaukee or waukesha county circuit court as the case may be without unnecessary delay deposits may be made by mail or delivery to locations designated by the chief of the water safety patrol 1 permits referred to in this article shall be issued by the pewaukee lake water safety patrol there shall be no permit fee for single activities there shall be one $2000 permit fee for recurrent and like activities including supporting activities conducted throughout the boating season by a person or entity  151 5152001   4202010 reserved editors note adopted sept 20 201 repealed   which pertained to notification requirements for chemical treatment of aquatic plants and derived from a  1 adopted   and  adopted  secs   reserved article iii  public beaches glass containers for beverages prohibited no person shall sell or offer for sale or carry or use any glass container containing a liquid beverage upon any public beach in the village of pewaukee 031 littering prohibited no person shall deposit any refuse trash rubbish or other waste upon a public beach within the village of pewaukee 032 cross reference littering generally   et seq closing hours a beach rules the lakefront beach located in the village of pewaukee is hereby subject to the following rules and regulations said regulations shall govern the use by all persons of the beach 1 all persons in the beach area shall obey the lifeguard on duty 2 no person may utilize flotation devices flotation water toys or flotation swimwear when using the village beach or in the designated swim area of pewaukee lake 3 all animals are not permitted in the park 4 swimming outside of the swim area of pewaukee lake is only permitted in areas specifically designated for swimming 5 maneuvering or launching of boats is not permitted in the park exceptions to this section may be made by the village board for local nonprofit recreational organizations providing entertainment to the public upon the recommendation of the joint park and recreation board 6 fishing is not permitted in the designated swim areas of pewaukee lake 7 children less than five years of age must be accompanied by an adult while swimming in the waters of pewaukee lake adjacent to the village beach 8 swimming from the fishing pier is prohibited 9 docking of boats shall not be permitted on the fishing pier 10 trespassing is prohibited on the railroad tracks adjacent to the village beach 11 open fires or grilling are prohibited on the village beach 12 visiting with lifeguards is not permitted except in the discharge of their professional duties b the beach area shall be open for use between  am and  pm no one is permitted within the beach area outside of these hours 033    1262005   652007 article iv  aquatic weed commission footnotes  3  cross reference administration ch 2 state law reference control of aquatic nuisances generally wis stats    cutting weeds in navigable waters nuisance if weeds not removed wis stats   established an aquatic weed commission advisory to the village board is established to consist of the village trustee in charge of parks and lakes who shall be its presiding officer and three citizen members citizen members will be persons of recognized experience and qualifications 081 membership a the trustee member of the aquatic weed commission shall be a member of the commission for so long as his elective term of office shall run b one citizen member shall be appointed by the village president subject to confirmation of the village board annually during april for a term of three years c all vacancies on the commission shall be filled for the unexpired term in the same manner as appointment for the full term d no compensation shall be paid for service on the commission citizen members shall take the official oath required by wis stats  1901 which shall be filed with the clerktreasurer 082 organization a the aquatic weed commission shall elect a vicechairman secretary and such other officers as may in its judgment be necessary b the commission shall keep a written record of its proceedings to include all actions taken a copy of which will be filed with the clerktreasurer all actions taken shall require the approval of a majority of all of the members of the commission c as far as possible the commission shall utilize the services of existing village of pewaukee officials and employees 083 powers and duties a the aquatic weed commission shall make recommendations in writing to the village board concerning methods of control of the growth of aquatic weeds in waters lying within the village together with recommendations designating areas to be controlled and indicating periods for the exercise of such control and shall have such other powers and duties not in conflict with statute as shall be vested in it by the village board b any proposed method time or area of control of aquatic weeds shall be referred to the commission for its consideration and report before final action is taken by the village board c in addition to the powers enumerated in this section and other powers granted by statute and the village board the commission shall make an annual report of its activities to the village board before december 1 of each year 084 code comparative table 1967 code this table gives the location within this those
